title: Scaffold NestJS Project and Configure Base Settings
description: Use the NestJS CLI (`@nestjs/cli`) to generate a new monorepo project. Configure `tsconfig.json` for strict type checking and `nest-cli.json` for standard source root. Initialize the Git repository.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: The project is successfully created using `nest new`. The application compiles and starts without errors.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Successful execution of `npm run build` and `npm run start:dev` commands.
deployment_notes: Initial commit to the new repository.
business_value: Establishes the initial codebase and project structure for all backend development.

title: Configure TypeORM and Database Connection Module
description: Install `typeorm`, `pg`, `@nestjs/typeorm`. Create a configuration service using `@nestjs/config` to load database credentials from environment variables. Configure `TypeOrmModule.forRootAsync`.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: The NestJS application successfully connects to a local PostgreSQL database on startup. Database credentials are loaded from environment variables.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
external_dependencies: Local PostgreSQL instance must be running.
testing_requirements: Application startup logs show a successful database connection.
business_value: Enables data persistence for all application features, connecting the application logic to the database.

title: Set up TypeORM Migration Configuration
description: Create a `ormconfig.ts` or equivalent data source configuration file for the TypeORM CLI. Add npm scripts for creating and running migrations.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: The `typeorm migration:generate` and `typeorm migration:run` commands can be run successfully. An initial empty migration can be created and applied.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Successful execution of migration commands from the command line.
business_value: Enables version-controlled database schema management.

title: Integrate and Configure `nestjs-pino`
description: Install and configure `nestjs-pino` to produce structured JSON logs in production and pretty-printed logs in development.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: Logs are pretty-printed in dev and JSON formatted in prod. Each log object contains standard fields like level, time, and msg.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Inspect console output in both development and production modes.
business_value: Enables effective, searchable, and analyzable logging in production environments.

title: Implement Middleware for Correlation ID Logging
description: Create a NestJS middleware to inject a correlation ID into the Pino logger context for each request.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: All logs generated during a single API request contain the same `correlationId` field. Middleware uses incoming header or generates a new ID.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Inspect logs to verify all entries for a single request share a `correlationId`.
business_value: Enables end-to-end request tracing across distributed services.

title: Set up Passport.js with JWT Strategy
description: Implement a `JwtStrategy` using `passport-jwt` and `jwks-rsa` to validate Cognito JWT signatures against the JWKS endpoint.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: The JwtStrategy is defined and correctly configured. It successfully validates a valid JWT and rejects invalid ones.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
external_dependencies: AWS Cognito User Pool must be configured.
testing_requirements: Unit tests for the JwtStrategy.
business_value: Secures all protected API endpoints by validating user identity.

title: Implement Global JWT Auth Guard
description: Create a `JwtAuthGuard` and apply it globally. Create a `@Public()` decorator to exempt specific routes from authentication.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: A `JwtAuthGuard` is applied globally. A `@Public()` decorator allows unauthenticated access. All other endpoints return 401 Unauthorized without a valid JWT.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests using Supertest to hit protected and public endpoints.
business_value: Establishes the default security posture for the entire API.

title: Create TypeORM Entities for All User Data Models
description: Create entity files for `users`, `custom_modes`, `user_variables`, and `calculation_history` with all columns, relationships, and constraints.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: Four entity files are created with all specified columns and decorators. Relationships are correctly defined. The `definition` column in `CustomMode` is `jsonb`.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Code review and successful migration generation.
business_value: Defines the application's data model in code.

title: Generate and Refine Initial Database Migration Script
description: Use the TypeORM CLI to generate an initial migration script from entities. Manually review and refine the generated SQL.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: A new, versioned migration file is created. The migration script successfully runs and creates the correct schema. The script's `down` method successfully drops all tables.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Running `npm run migration:run` and inspecting the database schema.
business_value: Creates the physical database structure required to store application data.

title: Create User record upon Cognito registration
description: Implement a mechanism to create a user record in the local `users` table after a new user successfully registers with Cognito, likely via an on-demand check in the auth guard.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: When a new user logs in for the first time, a new record is created in the `users` table with the correct `auth_provider_id` and email.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test: Authenticate as a new user and verify a record is created in the `users` table.
business_value: Links the identity provider's user with the application's internal user data model.

title: Add `terms_accepted_at` to User Schema and Migration
description: Add a `termsAcceptedAt` nullable timestamp column to the `user.entity.ts` and generate a migration script.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: The `user.entity.ts` is updated. A new migration script is generated and runs successfully.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Running the migration and inspecting the DB schema.
business_value: Adds the necessary database field to track legal consent.

title: Update Registration Logic to Record Acceptance
description: Modify the backend logic that creates a new user to set the `terms_accepted_at` field to the current timestamp.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: When a new user is created in the database, the `terms_accepted_at` column is populated with a valid timestamp.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test that creates a new user and asserts the value of the `terms_accepted_at` column.
business_value: Provides an auditable record of user consent.

title: Write Integration Test for ToS Acceptance
description: Create an integration test that simulates registration and verifies the `terms_accepted_at` timestamp is correctly recorded.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: Test successfully creates a new user and asserts that the `terms_accepted_at` field is not null and is a valid timestamp.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Passing test in CI pipeline.
business_value: Ensures the ToS acceptance feature is correctly implemented and auditable.

title: Create VariablesModule and DTOs
description: Generate the `variables` module and create DTOs for create/update operations with `class-validator` decorators.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: Module, controller, service files created. DTOs defined with validation rules.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Code review.
business_value: Scaffolds the API module for user variables.

title: Implement Service Logic for Variables CRUD
description: Implement `create`, `findAllByUser`, `update`, and `delete` methods in the service, ensuring all queries are scoped by user ID.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: All CRUD methods are implemented correctly and securely scoped to the user.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests.
business_value: Implements the core business logic for managing user variables.

title: Implement Controller and Routes for Variables
description: Implement controller methods for GET, POST, PUT, DELETE on the `/variables` resource, applying the auth guard.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: All four CRUD endpoints are implemented and protected by the auth guard. User ID is passed to the service layer.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests.
business_value: Exposes the variable management functionality via a secure REST API.

title: Write Unit and Integration Tests for Variables API
description: Write Jest unit tests for the service and Supertest integration tests for the controller, covering happy paths, auth errors, and validation.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: Unit test coverage for service is >= 85%. Integration tests cover all endpoints. A specific test confirms data isolation between users.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: CI pipeline test execution passes.
business_value: Ensures the variables API is robust, secure, and functions as expected.

title: Implement History Module, Controller, and Service
description: Implement `create` and `findAllByUser` methods for calculation history, scoped by user ID.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: A user can successfully POST a new history item and GET their list of history items. All endpoints are protected.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests.
business_value: Provides the backend support for persisting user calculation history.

title: Write Unit and Integration Tests for History API
description: Write Jest and Supertest tests for the History API, covering auth and data scoping.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: Unit test coverage for service is >= 85%. Integration tests cover GET and POST endpoints and confirm data scoping by user.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: CI pipeline test execution passes.
business_value: Ensures the history API is robust and secure.

title: Implement Transactional Database Deletion Logic
description: Create a `deleteAccount` method using TypeORM's transaction support to delete a user and all their associated data from all relevant tables.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: The method correctly deletes all associated records. If any deletion fails, the entire transaction is rolled back.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests that mock transaction success and failure.
business_value: Implements the data erasure part of the 'right to be forgotten'.

title: Integrate Cognito User Deletion with Rollback
description: Extend `deleteAccount` to call the AWS Cognito `AdminDeleteUser` API after the database transaction commits. Log critical errors on failure.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: On success, the user is deleted from both PostgreSQL and Cognito. If Cognito deletion fails, a critical error is logged.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E test for the full deletion flow.
business_value: Completes the account deletion process by removing the user from the identity provider.

title: Set up Lambda Project and `isolated-vm`
description: Create a new Node.js project for the formula execution Lambda. Install and configure `isolated-vm`, handling any native dependency builds required for the Lambda environment.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: A basic Lambda function using `isolated-vm` can be created and deployed. A simple script can be successfully executed within an isolate.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Successful deployment and manual invocation of the test Lambda.
deployment_notes: May require a custom Docker image for the Lambda.
business_value: Creates the secure sandbox environment, which is the cornerstone of safely executing untrusted user code.

title: Implement Sandbox Context and Execution Logic
description: Implement the core Lambda logic to create a V8 Isolate, inject an allow-list of functions and constants, and execute the user script with strict timeout and memory limits.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: User formulas can successfully call injected functions. Attempts to call disallowed functions throw an error. Execution terminates on timeout.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests.
business_value: Implements the core logic for secure, isolated execution of user code.

title: Write Unit Tests for Formula Execution Lambda
description: Create a comprehensive Jest unit test suite for the Lambda handler, covering valid formulas, disallowed functions, syntax errors, and timeouts.
sprint_goal: Establish Foundational Framework, Core Auth & Secure Sandbox POC
acceptance_criteria: Test coverage is >= 90%. Specific tests assert failure for `Math.random` and success for `sin(pi)`. A timeout test for an infinite loop passes.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Passing tests in CI pipeline.
business_value: Ensures the secure sandbox is robust and correctly configured to prevent escapes.

title: Implement Service and Controller for Custom Modes
description: Implement the four CRUD methods in the service and controller for custom modes, ensuring all queries are scoped by user ID.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: All four CRUD endpoints are implemented and protected. Data is correctly saved to and retrieved from the `custom_modes` table.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests.
business_value: Provides the persistence layer for the custom modes feature.

title: Write Unit and Integration Tests for Custom Modes API
description: Write Jest and Supertest tests for the custom modes controller and service, including a test to ensure data isolation between users.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: Unit test coverage for the service is >= 85%. Integration tests cover all endpoints. The cross-user access test asserts a 403/404 response.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Passing tests in CI.
business_value: Ensures the custom modes API is robust, secure, and functions correctly.

title: Implement `execute` Controller and Service Method
description: Create `POST /custom-modes/:id/execute` endpoint to validate inputs, invoke the Formula Execution Lambda, and return the result.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint is protected and authorized for the mode owner. It correctly invokes the Lambda and returns the result or error.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test.
business_value: Connects the user-created content with the secure execution environment.

title: Write Integration Test for Execution Endpoint
description: Create a Supertest integration test that calls the execution endpoint, mocking the AWS Lambda invocation to test success, error, and auth paths.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: Test successfully mocks the Lambda SDK call and verifies success, Lambda error, and auth error paths.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Passing tests in CI.
business_value: Ensures the orchestration logic for custom mode execution is correct and secure.

title: Implement `export` Endpoint for Custom Modes
description: Create a `GET /custom-modes/:id/export` endpoint to serialize a mode into the specified JSON format and trigger a file download.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint returns valid JSON matching the export schema. Response headers trigger a file download. Unauthorized access is blocked.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test.
business_value: Enables backup and sharing of user-created content.

title: Implement `import` Endpoint and Validation Logic
description: Create a `POST /custom-modes/import` endpoint for file upload with robust validation for JSON syntax, schema, and business rules.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint imports a valid file. Rejects malformed JSON (400) and invalid schema (422). Handles name conflicts by renaming.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests with valid and various invalid file examples.
business_value: Allows users to restore backups and use modes shared by others.

title: Add API documentation for all new endpoints
description: Use `@nestjs/swagger` decorators to document all controllers, DTOs, and API responses, ensuring the generated OpenAPI 3.0 spec is complete.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: The `/api-docs` endpoint serves a valid OpenAPI 3.0 spec. All endpoints and DTOs are documented, including security schemes.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Viewing the generated spec at the `/api-docs` endpoint and verifying its completeness.
business_value: Provides clear, auto-generated documentation for API consumers (e.g., frontend team).

title: Develop API Endpoint to Initiate Export Job
description: Create a `POST /users/me/data-export` endpoint that validates the request and publishes a job message to an SQS queue.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint returns 202 Accepted. A message with `userId` is sent to SQS. Subsequent requests are rejected with 409 Conflict.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test.
business_value: Initiates the asynchronous process for GDPR/CCPA data export requests.

title: Implement Data Aggregation Lambda Worker
description: Create a Lambda triggered by SQS to fetch all data for a user from the RDS database.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: Lambda is triggered by SQS. It connects to RDS via VPC and fetches a complete user dataset.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests and manual invocation in AWS console.
business_value: Performs the heavy lifting of gathering all of a user's data for export.

title: Implement Secure File Storage and Notification
description: Extend the Lambda to upload the aggregated JSON to a private S3 bucket, generate a pre-signed URL, and email it to the user via SES.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: JSON file is uploaded to S3. A valid 24-hour pre-signed URL is generated. An email with the link is sent via SES.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E test: trigger API, check S3, check test email inbox.
business_value: Completes the data export process by securely delivering the data to the user.

title: Implement Error Handling and DLQ for Export Job
description: Configure an SQS Dead Letter Queue. Implement error handling in the Lambda to move failed jobs to the DLQ and notify the user of the failure.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: A DLQ is configured. A simulated failure causes the message to move to the DLQ after retries. The user is notified of the failure via email.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test that simulates a Lambda failure and verifies the message appears in the DLQ.
business_value: Makes the asynchronous export process robust and auditable.

title: Modify `variables` endpoint to handle batch updates
description: Modify the variables endpoint to accept an array of variable objects for efficient synchronization from offline clients.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint accepts an array of variable DTOs and performs an upsert for each item.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test.
business_value: Provides an efficient mechanism for offline clients to sync multiple changes at once.

title: Implement 'Last-Write-Wins' Conflict Resolution
description: In the variable sync logic, compare client and server timestamps to reject stale updates, returning a 409 Conflict with the authoritative server state.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: If `client.updatedAt <= db.updatedAt`, the update is rejected with a 409. If `client.updatedAt > db.updatedAt`, the update is accepted.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test specifically designed to simulate a conflict scenario.
business_value: Prevents data corruption and ensures data consistency for users operating on multiple devices or with intermittent connectivity.

title: Modify `history` endpoint to handle batch appends
description: Modify the `POST /history` endpoint to accept an array of history items for efficient offline synchronization.
sprint_goal: Custom Mode APIs, Offline Sync & Compliance Features
acceptance_criteria: The endpoint accepts an array of history DTOs. All valid items in the batch are successfully saved.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration test.
business_value: Provides an efficient mechanism for offline clients to sync new calculation history items.
